Some artists pay attention with unusual focus, others go to sleep but most are in between when it comes to the details of the music business. I did the work for the music video and marketing and this artist was paying attention, the moment I began on contracts he went to sleep!

On the business side of the music business, artists have a few options but all the options mean that you yourself must understand what is happening. Hire a manager, hire a team etc but you must still keep an eye out. Olu Maintain says his bank manager is the one who schooled him.

Not having a simple understanding of what things mean in the music business as an artist means that as things move along you will get confused, throw your hands up and then get screwed. Happens all the time.

It may not be the best use of an artist's time to get every intimate detail of the music business, he may find it boring or like 'school' but as he gets on in the business things will get more complicated so he needs a basic understanding of what is happening and why.
Anybody know the color of the dress I was wearing down at the men in music business conference????

In most other businesses in life, you have to grind to understand how the business works before you can make a profit or any money at it but in the music business all you need is to be able to drop hits to get paid. You don't need to understand the music business.

For the first time in the history of the music business, record labels are insisting on a piece of the artist's revenue from non-record sources. They want songwriting, touring, merch which doesn't concern them. Why do they want this, why would artists even agree to this shit?

Digital distribution of music is the largest portion of the music business, demand for music is mad everywhere and artists now have direct access to the music fans. There really aren't anymore middlemen unless you want there to be.

Piracy is doing well in the music business, CD sales are dead and digital sales aren't making up for what CDs would've made. Record labels are looking for money upandan ergo the 360 deal and Corona just about slaughtered everybody. Debit alert ad infinitum.

This is where we are at, right now. The autumn of web2 in regards to the music business.

This business is vast. It touches on:
- production
- distribution
- curation
- administration of copyrights
- management
- performance
- marketing
- songwriting
- equipment suppliers

etc.

The Big 5 (5 recording labels that controlled the global music business: EMI, Sony, BMG, Universal and Warner Bros) had to sober up. BMG merged with Sony and EMI was eventually split: the publishing division going to Sony and recording going to Universal in 2012. 

Only 3 remain.
